intro: Lysimachia kipahuluensis subsp. caliginis, commonly known as the Kipahulu fumewort, is a rare and endemic plant species found exclusively in the wet forests of Hawaii. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant thrives in shaded, moist environments, typically growing near the forest floor in areas with high humidity. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and human disturbance. Conservation efforts are crucial to protect this unique botanical species.
